parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Apollos, a Jew of Alexandria. Probably from the same as Apollonia; Apollos, an Israelite.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.
Probably from an obsolete diako; an attendant, i.e. a waiter; specially, a Christian teacher and pastor.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Plural
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.
Each (of more than two), every one. As if a superlative of hekas; each or every.
